properties.Name: Kiwanis Mosaic
properties.Descriptn: The Kiwanis mosaic, built in 2011 by Liz Calvin, appears outside of the Moody Park Outdoor Pool. The "K" on the mosaic is reminiscent of the letter that appeared on the front of the old Kiwanis Pool,
properties.summary: The Kiwanis mosaic, built in 2011 by Liz Calvin, appears outside of the Moody Park Outdoor Pool. The "K" on the mosaic is reminiscent of the letter that appeared on the front of the old Kiwanis Pool, which served the community from 1948 to 2006.

properties.Name: Kiwanis Mosaic
properties.Descriptn: The Kiwanis mosaic, built in 2011 by Liz Calvin, appears outside of the Moody Park Outdoor Pool. The "K" on the mosaic is reminiscent of the letter that appeared on the front of the old Kiwanis Pool,

properties.Name: Pump House Mural
properties.Descriptn: "Puzzled," (2013) by artist Steve Hornung brightens the side of an otherwise drab pump house. The mural features a boy with a slingshot, three moose, and interlocking puzzle pieces.
properties.summary: "Puzzled," (2013) by artist Steve Hornung brightens the side of an otherwise drab pump house. The mural features a boy with a slingshot, three moose, and interlocking puzzle pieces.

properties.Name: The YAI Project (Mural)
properties.Descriptn: The YAI project is a mural initiated by Queensborough youth.
properties.summary: The YAI project is a mural initiated by Queensborough youth.

properties.Name: Cenotaph
properties.Descriptn: The Cenotaph (or War Memorial) was created for Armistice Day, 1922, to commemorate soldiers who gave their lives in the service of Canada. The clay sculpture for the monument was made by Major George
properties.summary: The Cenotaph (or War Memorial) was created for Armistice Day, 1922, to commemorate soldiers who gave their lives in the service of Canada. The clay sculpture for the monument was made by Major George Patterson, M.C.; the plaster cast was made by Vancouve

properties.Name: Alpha Ball and Cast Books
properties.Descriptn: The Alpha Ball and Cast Books were installed in 2002 by Tony Bloom and Richard Findlay.
properties.summary: The Alpha Ball and Cast Books were installed in 2002 by Tony Bloom and Richard Findlay.

properties.Name: Columbia Street Mosaics
properties.Descriptn: The Columbia Street mosaics and panels were commissioned from Bruce Walther and Liz Calvin in 2012. They depict a variety of New Westminster's related scenes. Individual pieces are titled King Neptune
properties.summary: The Columbia Street mosaics and panels were commissioned from Bruce Walther and Liz Calvin in 2012. They depict a variety of New Westminster's related scenes.

properties.Name: Brewery District Mosaic
properties.Descriptn: The Brewery District mosaic was commissioned from Bruce Walther in 2011.
properties.summary: The Brewery District mosaic was commissioned from Bruce Walther in 2011.

properties.Name: Twelfth Street Mosaics
properties.Address: Twelfth Street between Tenth and Sixth
properties.Descriptn: The Twelfth Street mosaics were created by Bruce Walther and Ann Wilson. These first mosaics in the city are the result of a community project initiated by resident Mary Wilson.
properties.summary: The Twelfth Street mosaics were created by Bruce Walther and Ann Wilson. These first mosaics in the city are the result of a community project initiated by resident Mary Wilson.

properties.Name: Sapperton Mosaics
properties.Address: East Columbia between Sherbrooke and Braid
properties.Descriptn: These four mosaics were created in 2011 by Bruce Walther and Ann Wilson. They feature Colonel Moody and the British Sappers; the Sapperton Theatre and Bowling Alley; the Fraser River and Patullo Bridg
properties.summary: These four mosaics were created in 2011 by Bruce Walther and Ann Wilson. They feature Colonel Moody and the British Sappers; the Sapperton Theatre and Bowling Alley; the Fraser River and Patullo Bridge; and Cap's Bicycles and Cap Hobbies.

properties.Name: Tin Soldier
properties.Descriptn: In 2011, the City of New Westminster purchased the World's Tallest Tin Soldier from the Simon Fraser Society for Community Living. It represents a Sergeant Major of the Royal Engineers Columbia Detach
properties.summary: In 2011, the City of New Westminster purchased the World's Tallest Tin Soldier from the Simon Fraser Society for Community Living. It represents a Sergeant Major of the Royal Engineers Columbia Detachment. It was designed to be a special friend to all ch

properties.Name: Puddle Jumper
properties.Descriptn: "Puddle Jumper" is a 2008 sculpture by Holly Young. It depicts a young boy in a raincoat preparing to jump into a puddle.
properties.summary: "Puddle Jumper" is a 2008 sculpture by Holly Young. It depicts a young boy in a raincoat preparing to jump into a puddle.

properties.Name: Ab oVo
properties.Descriptn: Sculpture made in 2009 by Carlos Basanta (sculpter), Davide Pan (sculpter assistant), Darren Joseph (QayQayt graphic artist) and Ray Natraoro (QayQayt painter).
properties.summary: Sculpture made in 2009 by Carlos Basanta (sculpter), Davide Pan (sculpter assistant), Darren Joseph (QayQayt graphic artist) and Ray Natraoro (QayQayt painter).

properties.Name: Diver Inverse
properties.Descriptn: Diver Inverse is a developer-initiated public art project by sculptor David Robinson. It depicts a life-size diving figure on a three-sided, 16-foot-tall concrete plinth in Renaissance Square. It was
properties.summary: Diver Inverse is a developer-initiated public art project by sculptor David Robinson. It depicts a life-size diving figure on a three-sided, 16-foot-tall concrete plinth in Renaissance Square. It was donated to the residents of New Westminster by Aragon

properties.Name: Orca Whale
properties.Descriptn: This colourful orca sculpture was donated to the city after the Vancouver 2010 winter games.
properties.summary: This colourful orca sculpture was donated to the city after the Vancouver 2010 winter games.

properties.Name: Tipperary Park Cosmic May Pole
properties.Descriptn: In 1980, a 70-foot red cedar Cosmic Maypole was erected in the Friendship Gardens. The carving, done by Georganna Malloff, is to be viewed not frontally, but in the round, depicting a spiral of human
properties.summary: In 1980, a 70-foot red cedar Cosmic Maypole was erected in the Friendship Gardens.

properties.Name: Queen's Park Totem Pole
properties.Descriptn: As part of the 1967 Centennial project, residents from each New Westminster, Surrey, Coquitlam and Burnaby carved a totem pole. The head carver of the New Westminster totem pole was Lloyd Wadhams, wit
properties.summary: As part of the 1967 Centennial project, residents from each New Westminster, Surrey, Coquitlam and Burnaby carved a totem pole.

properties.Name: Rotary Clock
properties.Descriptn: The Rotary Clock sits in the plaza in Moody Park. It was donated in 2006 by the Rotary Club of New Westminster.
properties.summary: The Rotary Clock sits in the plaza in Moody Park. It was donated in 2006 by the Rotary Club of New Westminster.

properties.Name: Bounce Ball
properties.Descriptn: This public art piece, designed by landscape architect Richard Findlay, is installed in Sukh Sagar Park in Queensborough.
properties.summary: This public art piece, designed by landscape architect Richard Findlay, is installed in Sukh Sagar Park in Queensborough.

properties.Name: Queensborough Mosaic
properties.Descriptn: The Queensborough mosaic was created by Liz Calvin as part of the Olympic Torch initiative.
properties.summary: The Queensborough mosaic was created by Liz Calvin as part of the Olympic Torch initiative.

properties.Name: Wait for Me Daddy
properties.Descriptn: The Wait For Me, Daddy project was inspired by the historic and iconic photograph taken by Claude Dettloff on October 1, 1940 in New Westminster at Columbia and 8th Streets. The image of a child bre
properties.summary: Commissioned by the City of New Westminster, Wait for me Daddy is a war memorial based on Vancouver Province photographer Claude P. Dettloffs famous 1940s picture, Wait for Me Daddy.  Artists:  Veronica and Edwin Dam de Nogales

properties.Name: New Media Gallery
properties.Descriptn: The New Media Gallery is a non-collecting institution, dedicated to presenting innovative, high quality exhibitions of international, national and regional new media art. Our exhibition programming in
properties.summary: A contemporary, public, art gallery devoted to the exciting presentation of international, national and regional new media art.  Free to all.
